      • getFallbackName

        public static java.lang.String getFallbackName(java.lang.String fontName,
                                               int fontSize,
                                               EditorColorsScheme fallbackScheme)
        There is a possible case that particular font family is not available at particular environment (e.g. Monaco under *nix). However, java environment tries to mask that via 'Dialog' fonts, i.e. when we try to create font like new Font("Monaco", style, size), it creates a font object which has font family "Monaco" but is a "Dialog" font.

        That's why we have a special check for such a situation.

        Parameters:
        fontName - font family name to check
        fontSize - target font size
        fallbackScheme - colors scheme to use for fallback fonts retrieval (if necessary);
        Returns:
        fallback font family to use if font family with the given name is not registered at current environment; null if font family with the given name is registered at the current environment

      • getDefaultFontName

        public static java.lang.String getDefaultFontName()
